creator: mathias_jud@saibo.ch
text:
Hi all

After testing the lenya authoring-right-management, 
I have some usability enhancement proposition:

If a logged in author, tries to enter the administration-section 
in lenya, he just recieves a login-screen without any 
message. While trying to log in with a limited author 
password he never sees anything else then a clean 
login screen...

-> tell the user whats happening! and what the problem is!

------------------------------------------------------

you mean something: "You need to be administrator to enter the Admin 
area. Please contact foo <at> bar.com for more information" ?

Michi

-------------------------------------------------------

eventually also with the information, "what" the user is at the moment:
You need to be ...
You are logged in as  ...

creator: gregor@apache.org
text: good points. we need to pass this context info into the login screen

after two years this issue is still unresolved in trunk (can't test 1.2, for
which it was originally reported)
a recent discussion on the dev list also drew no reaction (see
http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.lenya.devel/15704).

i consider this a major usability problem, and the archive shows that it's
becoming some sort of faq.
